overall the following things can be improved the primary key for the real estate company should be auto generated. this is done automatically by the rails framework so maybe you can remove the code from the view which asks for the user to select the primary key while creating company. whenever there is reference to foreign key in model you can validate and use that reference by following the format model id where model is the entity of your foreign key. eg. if house has foreign key of reactor reactor is the entity of your foreign key hence you can reference the reactor as reactor id in your house model. this is because rails follows convention over configuration and this is the naming convention with respect to foreign keys.

nicely implemented code. used ruby delegations appropriately and the code is very readable. however few things can be improved. for eg in inquiry replies controller flash is used to transfer data from the new method to the method which is not the correct way. also i believe that the implementation can be made more efficient by reducing the number of database hits. for example in almost all the controllers there are redundant database hits session role type buyer could have been identified during login. a second hit to identify the role type or any such info can be avoided. for small test database this would not show any performance decrease but as the records increase the pages will become exponentially slower. maybe you can store these in memory session. which would reduce time taken significantly at small memory overhead.

the write up is good but it does feel much refined or improvised after the initial edit. as mentioned above the image in visible clearly which means that it was reviewed much after posting. but apart from that the flow of the write up is very effective in fact one of the best that i ve reviewed. the concept of giving higher level view and then diving deeper into the implementation is very subtly applied.

the write up starts with introduction about test driven development and unit testing. it then moves over to describing the problem statement team members test plan and implementation that contains detailed documentation on the procedure to set up the environment of menu model sample views declaration of mock objects as test entries and finally the conditions tested on each of the method of the node and menu class. the various methods tested on the node class include initiative setup site controller controller action content page and add child. similarly the methods tested on the menu class include initiative select get item get menu selected selected. and crumbs. the write up also includes the screenshot of the spec tests that were run. the screenshot of the simpleton coverage report is blurred and not readable. the write up ends with concluding remarks learning outcomes and references. overall the documentation was very precise and clear with all the information needed to understand the code on the authors could have included and highlighted how to run the spec code since their project specifically deals with unit testing. another apparent issue that i can point out is the quality of screenshot.
the overall is good but they did change the problem related to test plan like i mentioned last time.
most of them are good but some edge cases should be considered.

the given source code is ready for deployment. the object under test is fully covered and all of the test cases are implemented correctly. the build successfully passes travis ci. the future team will have no problems in picking up from here. however there is room for further improvement when it comes to simplifying several test cases especially versions from reviewer block. moreover it blocks need to be removed because the final version should not contain any tests that are in the pending state.
the function process seems to be bit long. it could have been splitter based on oscillator types rather than having all of them in the same function. apart from that rest of the code seems great.

the team has completed the missing code in the file oscillator which generates different wave forms like sine square sawtooth and triangle. they then created the file that generates objects and calls methods to run the different oscillator type examples. the code in both these rust files have good comments that clearly explain what every snippet does and the significance of variables. this made it easy to follow the syntax and semantics of new programming language like rust rust is systems programming language that focuses on memory safety and concurrency. the variable names used are intuitive and the code is well indented. one issue that i can point out here is that the code is lengthy and complex with lot of redundancy especially those that define the audio context destination node oscillator and few other local variables in the file are repeated for every oscillator waveform and can certainly be encapsulated in one function that can be called only once in the file.

the team test plan includes running the oscillator binary file using the command. oscillator. this will run the where various oscillator nodes corresponding to sine square sawtooth and triangle waveforms are generated. hence the user will be able to listen to these waves after definite interval.

the starts off by introducing servo experimental high performance browser engine and rust which is systems programming language with memory safety and concurrency used to build servo. it then moves over to web audio api for handling audio operations inside audio context and allow modular routing and workflow for implementing web audio was clearly listed. it then flows into the scope of the project and the implementation. the graphical and mathematical representation of the sine square sawtooth and triangle waveform gave solid conceptual foundation. the code snippet of the changes done in oscillator and the new file created by the team has also been included. the section build that explains the procedure to install dependencies rust step by step procedure for building and running the build was very useful to explore the project. the team had included the build instructions for windows and based they could have augmented the build instructions for mac os x which might save mac users from reading verbose instructions on the official documentation and instead refer to single source the the authors end the by providing the test plan with examples of generated sine square sawtooth and triangle waveforms as audio files pull request and references.
i believe this code is ready to be deployed and if it in it can definitely be picked up in the future.

the design appears to be sound for most part of it. the linking between the different sections seems appropriate. the only issue i have is with the mock up in the design details second change mock up number. i think that the bar chart is being displayed for each and every day. i feel that is not only highly unnecessary but also would be very overwhelming for the instructor to process all this information because it is common knowledge that many students do not begin projects until few days weeks would have passed since the assignment is posted. so that would leave the initial few days of the bar chart empty with nothing valuable to show the duration of each project varies from project to project. assignment had duration of about days. this would mean that there would be about bar charts for each day which would be quite difficult for the ta instructor to process for just one team let alone for so many other teams they need to evaluate. suggestions instead of providing bar chart for each day aggregate it to bar chart for each week or one in days. and then maybe towards the deadline or like week before the deadline you could switch to per day. or provide an option to switch between the scaling of time periods like week days day etc.
